channel.title: "Please make sure path and file name are correct."
channel.description: Hi, I'm new, yeah, anyway.. Whenever I try to edit any of the .cfg files under the Hybridscape folder, I get the following error: [code]Cannot create the C:\Program Files\Moparscape\Hybridscape\item.cfg file. Please make sure that the path and file name are correct.[/code] Obviously, clicked 'ok', and tried to save it again, the same thing comes up, press ok, and the whole thing just exits out. I've been working on this problem for a while but can't find out what I'm doing wrong, and would realllly appreciate some help... And if this is a really sad error by me, please don't flame me, I'm not a rocket scientist. I've read nearly every tutorial and searched for help already, so as far as I know I'm not breaking any rules... Help? Thankz.

item.title: "Please make sure path and file name are correct."
item.dc:creator: @thugscape thugscape
item.description:
@thugscape wrote:

Ok. Hybrid scape is the worst possible Scource ANYONE in the whole entire world EVER could get. Get a better scource and it will work.

Read full topic

item.title: "Please make sure path and file name are correct."
item.dc:creator: @beetle179 beetle179
item.description:
@beetle179 wrote:

Hi, I’m new, yeah, anyway…
Whenever I try to edit any of the .cfg files under the Hybridscape folder, I get the following error:

Cannot create the C:\Program Files\Moparscape\Hybridscape\item.cfg file. Please make sure that the path and file name are correct.
Obviously, clicked ‘ok’, and tried to save it again, the same thing comes up, press ok, and the whole thing just exits out. I’ve been working on this problem for a while but can’t find out what I’m doing wrong, and would realllly appreciate some help… And if this is a really sad error by me, please don’t flame me, I’m not a rocket scientist. I’ve read nearly every tutorial and searched for help already, so as far as I know I’m not breaking any rules…
Help?
Thankz.

Read full topic
item.source: "Please make sure path and file name are correct."
